Row.Text: The Guinea Pig of the World

Cannot train Settler. 2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes per era. 1 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Gold] Gold from International Trade routes, each increasing by 1 at Medieval, Industrial, Atomic Era. 1 [ICON_Citizen] Free Citizen and [ICON_Housing] Housing per district (up to 15), but -1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities per 3 districts (up to -5)

May build a second Holy Site, Campus, Harbor Commercial Hub, Theater or Industrial Zone that ignores Population restriction. However, these districts cannot build buildings and does not receive bonuses from beliefs, Social Policies, City-States, etc. All districts in the capital receive 5 times the regular adjacency bonus from adjacency to other districts.
The guinea pig of the world

Cannot train Settler. 2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes per era. [NEWLINE]1 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Gold] Gold from International Trade routes, each increasing by 1 at Medieval, Industrial, Atomic Era. [NEWLINE]1 [ICON_Citizen] Free Citizen and [ICON_Housing] Housing per district (up to 15), but -1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities per 3 districts (up to -5). However, these districts cannot build buildings and does not receive bonuses from beliefs, Social Policies, City-States, etc. [NEWLINE]All districts in the capital receive 5 times the regular adjacency bonus from adjacency to other districts.
Owner and Bouncer of VA-11 Hall-A
[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route cannot be plundered by enemy units. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory.
City with the British Trademark Council unique district may initiate 5 unique projects that each provides a unique luxury resource.

Likes peaceful civilizations that have a city on his home continent or send trade route at his city. Hates civilizations starting wars against a city-state or civilization based on his continent or anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
(You have kept the peace on his home continent.)
(You have attacked someone on his home continent.)
Dana Zane likes peaceful civs on his continent
Dana Zane hates attacks on civs based on his continent
Dana Zane hates it when you denounce his friends
Tries to have the highest possible [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn income. Respects other high income civilizations.
Julianne Stingray is pleased to see a high income civilization
Julianne Stingray dislike civilizations with low income

Glitch City unique unit that replace Mechanized Infantry. Weaker than normal Mechanized Infantry. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a district. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory. Unlocked by Urbanization.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a district. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a district.

Glitch City unique district that replace Entertainment Complex. provide +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per 1 [ICON_Citizen] citizen. This city receives +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold from foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes, while the owner of the Trade Route receives +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Julianne Stingray's unique project. Receive the Bad Touch Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Julianne Stingray's unique project. Receive the Piano Woman Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Julianne Stingray's unique project. Receive the Brandtini Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Julianne Stingray's unique project. Receive the Gut Punch Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Julianne Stingray's unique project. Receive the Zen Star Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.

Gltich City is the city where VA-11 Hall-A is located and all the characters live. It is a city run by mega corporations (namely Zaibatsu Corp.) and is rife with crime and corruption. However its also one of the forerunners in social advancements for non-humans, in particular Lilim. While the city is governed by mayor Quincy, he acts mostly as a puppet of Zaibatsu Corp.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Due to its advancements in technology and the disregard major companies have for experimentation on the general populace, Glitch City has earned the nickname "The guinea pig of the world."
Unknown (Coexist with Human, Lilim and talking dogs)

While Glitch City cannot train settlers and lose 1 Amenity per 3 Districts, Glitch City has many trade routes and may build additional Districts, while its districts in the capital has powerful adjacency bonus. In addition, Dana's Trade Routes cannot be pillaged and her units fight better in friendly territory, allowing her to defend more effectively.

While Glitch City cannot train settlers and lose 1 Amenity per 3 Districts, Glitch City has many trade routes and may build additional Districts, while its districts in the capital has powerful adjacency bonus. In addition, Dana's Trade Routes cannot be pillaged and her units fight better in friendly territory, allowing her to defend more effectively.

Dana Zane, commonly called "Dana" or simply "Boss", is the proprietor of VA-11 Hall-A, and oversees Jill and Gil. Dana has replaced her left arm with a mechanical prosthesis, and refuses to answer questions on when or how she lost her original, as "It's more interesting if it's left a mystery."
Why AREN'T you carrying a bucket of spicy chicken wings?

While Glitch City cannot train settlers and lose 1 Amenity per 3 Districts, Glitch City has many trade routes and may build additional Districts, while its districts in the capital has powerful adjacency bonus. In addition, Jill's unique luxury resources reduce the Amenity penalty, while the spares may be traded to other civilizations.

While Glitch City cannot train settlers and lose 1 Amenity per 3 Districts, Glitch City has many trade routes and may build additional Districts, while its districts in the capital has powerful adjacency bonus. In addition, Jill's unique luxury resources reduce the Amenity penalty, while the spares may be traded to other civilizations.

Julianne Natalie Stingray, or "Jill" as she is known, is the main protagonist and the bartender at VA-11 Hall-A. Half-French. Avid smoker. Bisexual. Went to college. Drinks a lot of beer. Has a cat named Fore, whom she talks to every time she's at home. She vaguely recalls having seen someone glitch out like how Anna Graem did in the past, but she doesn't remember when or where.
Time to mix drinks and change lives.

The White Knights are an organization within Glitch City, and act as authorities. However, during the story of the game, they would be discredited and disbanded. When you first meet Sei, she explains that the White knights are separated into different divisions that are meant to deal with different situations. For example Sei herself is a Valkyrie, who were White Knights meant to act as first responders during emergencies and are trained as both medics and rescue operatives.

The British Trademark Council entertains a chain of bars which VA-11 Hall-A is a part of. Due to financial troubles and allegations of criminal activities the BTC is currently in the process of closing around 40% of its bars in Glitch City, with VA-11 Hall-A being one of the bars under consideration.
Thanks for keeping the peace on the continent. Bully for you!
No man is above the law. It behooves you to remember that.
Your treasury is filling up quite nicely. It's always nice to have such strong income, isn't it?
Your empire is headed toward bankruptcy. How can you survive with debt piling up?
